title: Ghent
summary: Ghent (/ɡɛnt/ GHENT; Dutch: Gent [ɣɛnt] (listen); French: Gand [ɡɑ̃] (listen); traditional English: Gaunt) is a city and a municipality in the Flemish Region of Belgium. It is the capital and largest city of the East Flanders province, and the third largest in the country, exceeded in size only by Brussels and Antwerp.[2] It is a port and university city.
